body.p: In reaching its decisions relating to the lessee expense recognition model, the IASB observed that much of the negative feedback received in response to the single model proposed in the 2010 Exposure Draft related to the proposed measurement of lease assets and lease liabilities—in particular, the requirements for a lessee to estimate future variable lease payments and to determine the lease term based on the longest possible term that was more likely than not to occur. The measurement proposals for variable lease payments and optional lease periods were simplified in the 2013 Exposure Draft, and these simplifications have been retained in IFRS 16. As described in paragraph BC18, the IASB also introduced a number of further simplifications and exemptions after considering feedback on the 2013 Exposure Draft. The IASB expects the simpler measurement requirements and exemptions in IFRS 16 to alleviate many of the concerns that were received in response to the single model proposed in the 2010 Exposure Draft.
